text: Oracle of Judgment on Moab
An oracle of Moab:
Because Ar is devastated in a night, Moab is destroyed;
because Kir of Moab is devastated in a night, it is destroyed.
It has gone up \add to\add* the house,\f + \fr 15:2 \ft Or “temple” \f*
and Dibon \add to\add* the high places
for weeping over Nebo,
and Moab wails over Medeba.
⸤Every head is bald⸥,\f + \fr 15:2 \ft Literally “On all its heads baldness” \f*
every beard \add is\add* shaved.
They gird themselves \add with\add* sackcloth in its streets;
on its roofs and public squares everyone wails,
going down in weeping.
And Heshbon and Elealeh cry\f + \fr 15:4 \ft The Hebrew is singular \f* out,
their voice is heard as far as Jahaz;
therefore the armed ones of Moab cry out;
its soul quivers\f + \fr 15:4 \ft The Hebrew words for “cry out” and “quiver” are similar \f* for him.
My heart cries out for Moab;
its fugitives \add flee\add* up to Zoar,
to Eglath-shelishiyah.
For \add at\add* the ascent of Luhith it goes up it with weeping;
for \add on\add* the road of Horonaim they raise up a cry of destruction.
For the waters of Nimrim are wastelands;
for \add the\add* grass has withered,
\add the\add* vegetation has vanished,
\add there is\add* no greenness.
Therefore they carry \add the\add* abundance it has made
and their store of goods over the river of the poplars.
For \add a\add* cry for help has encircled the territory of Moab,
her wailing \add is heard\add* as far as Eglaim,
and her wailing \add as far as\add* Beer Elim.
For the waters of Dimon\f + \fr 15:9 \ft One of the Dead Sea Scrolls reads “Dibon” here \f* are full \add of\add* blood;
but I will place added things upon Dimon:
a lion for the survivors\f + \fr 15:9 \ft Hebrew “survivor” \f* of Moab
and for \add the\add* remnant of \add the\add* land.
